questions.questionText: A train running at the speed of 60 km/hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?

The length of the bridge, which a train 130 metres long and travelling at 45 km/hr can cross in 30 seconds, is:
A sum of money at simple interest amounts to Rs. 815 in 3 years and to Rs. 854 in 4 years. The sum is:
How much time will it take for an amount of Rs. 450 to yield Rs. 81 as interest at 4.5% per annum of simple interest?
It was Sunday on Jan 1, 2006. What was the day of the week Jan 1, 2010?
What was the day of the week on 28th May, 2006?
What was the day of the week on 17th June, 1998?

A and B complete a work in 6 days. A alone can do it in 10 days. If both together can do the work in how many days?

A train has a length of 150 metres. It is passing a man who is moving at 2                 km/hr in the same direction of the train, in 3 seconds. Find out the speed of the train.

A train moves past a post and a platform 264 metre long in 8 seconds and 20 seconds respectively. What is the speed of the train?

A is thrice as good as B in work. A is able to finish a job in 60 days less than B. They can finish the work in - days if they work together.
6 men and 8 women can complete a work in 10 days. 26 men and 48 women can finish the same work in 2 days. 15 men and 20 women can do the same work in - days.
P works twice as fast as Q. If Q alone can complete a work in 12 days, P and Q can finish the work in --- days
A person crosses a 600 metre long street in 5 minutes. What is his speed in km per hour?
A car traveling with 5/7 of its actual speed covers 42 km in 1 hr 40 min 48 sec. What is the actual speed of the car?
Two boys starts from the same place walking at the rate of 5 kmph and 5.5 kmph respectively in the same direction. What time will they take to be 8.5 km apart?
The price of 3 tables and 4 chairs is Rs.3300. With the same money one can buy 2 tables and 10 chairs. If one wants to buy 1 table and 1 chair, how much does he need to pay?
A man has some hens and cows. If the number of heads be 48 and the number of feet equals 140, then the number of hens will be
The probability that a number selected at random from the first 50 natural numbers is a composite number is :
A coin is tossed live times. What is the probability that there is at the least one tail?
If a number is chosen at random from the set {1, 2, 3, ...., 100}, then the probability that the chosen number is a perfect cube is :
Out of first 20 natural numbers, one number is selected at random. The probability that it is either an even number or a prime number is :
If four coins are tossed, the probability of getting two heads and two tails is :
If a card is drawn from a well shuffled pack of cards, the probability of drawing a spade or a king is :
If six persons sit in a row, then the probability that three particular persons are always together is :
A bag contains 7 green and 8 white balls. If two balls are drawn simultaneously, the probability that both are of the same colour is :
A basket has 5 apples and 4 oranges. Three fruits are picked at random. The probability that at least 2 apples are picked is :

A box contains nine bulbs out of which 4 are defective. If four bulbs are chosen at random, find the probability that atleast one bulb is good.
